00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 # Copyright (c) 2011 Google Inc. All rights reserved.

00004 # found in the LICENSE file.
00005 
00006 """These functions are executed via gyp-flock-tool when using the Makefile
00007 generator.  Used on systems that don't have a built-in flock."""
00008 
00009 import fcntl
00010 import os
00011 import struct
00012 import subprocess
00013 import sys
00014 
00015 
00016 def main(args):
00017   executor = FlockTool()
00018   executor.Dispatch(args)
00019 
00020 
00021 class FlockTool(object):
00022   """This class emulates the 'flock' command."""
00023   def Dispatch(self, args):
00024     """Dispatches a string command to a method."""
00025     if len(args) < 1:
00026       raise Exception("Not enough arguments")
00027 
00028     method = "Exec%s" % self._CommandifyName(args[0])
00029     getattr(self, method)(*args[1:])
00030 
00031   def _CommandifyName(self, name_string):
00032     """Transforms a tool name like copy-info-plist to CopyInfoPlist"""
00033     return name_string.title().replace('-', '')
00034 
00035   def ExecFlock(self, lockfile, *cmd_list):
00036     """Emulates the most basic behavior of Linux's flock(1)."""
00037     # Rely on exception handling to report errors.
00038     # Note that the stock python on SunOS has a bug
00039     # where fcntl.flock(fd, LOCK_EX) always fails
00040     # with EBADF, that's why we use this F_SETLK
00041     # hack instead.
00042     fd = os.open(lockfile, os.O_WRONLY|os.O_NOCTTY|os.O_CREAT, 0666)
00043     if sys.platform.startswith('aix'):
00044       # Python on AIX is compiled with LARGEFILE support, which changes the
00045       # struct size.
00046       op = struct.pack('hhIllqq', fcntl.F_WRLCK, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)
00047     else:
00048       op = struct.pack('hhllhhl', fcntl.F_WRLCK, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)
00049     fcntl.fcntl(fd, fcntl.F_SETLK, op)
00050     return subprocess.call(cmd_list)
00051 
00052 
00053 if __name__ == '__main__':
00054   sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))
